item.title: 新西兰议会将就青少年社交媒体禁令展开辩论
item.description: 新西兰官员周四表示，将向新西兰议会提交一项限制 16 岁以下儿童使用社交媒体的法案，为议会防止青少年在上网时受到伤害的努力造势。【原文：A bill to restrict social media for children under 16 will be introduced in the New Zealand parliament, officials said on Thursday, building momentum for parliament's efforts to prevent young people from being harmed while online.】

item.title: 特朗普打击移民，印度塔塔科技公司将在美国雇佣更多当地人
item.description: 塔塔科技公司（Tata Technologies）的顶头上司表示，该公司将在美国招募更多当地国民，因为这家印度工程服务提供商正在对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）大范围的移民打压做出反应。【原文：Tata Technologies will recruit more local nationals in the United States, its top boss said, as the Indian engineering services provider reacts to U.S. President Donald Trump's wide-ranging immigration crackdown.】

item.title: 媒体报道，佐治亚州州长坎普访问韩国，会见现代集团和 LG 公司官员
item.description: 据《Maeil Business Newspaper》周四报道，美国佐治亚州州长布莱恩-坎普（Brian Kemp）计划本周会见韩国商界领袖，包括现代汽车和 LG Energy Solution 的高管。【原文：Brian Kemp, the governor of the U.S. state of Georgia, plans to meet with South Korean business leaders this week, including executives from Hyundai Motor and LG Energy Solution, months after an immigration raid in the state detained hundreds of Korean workers, the Maeil Business Newspaper said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国可能对中国采取新的贸易遏制措施，亚洲市场出现回落
item.description: 亚洲股市周四连续第二天下跌，原因是科技大盘股乏善可陈的财报加深了华尔街的跌势，而美国对俄罗斯和中国的制裁则加剧了人们对地缘政治的担忧。石油价格飙升。【原文：Asian stocks fell for a second day on Thursday as lacklustre earnings reports from tech megacap stocks deepened a selloff on Wall Street, while U.S. sanctions against Russia and China revived fears around geopolitics. Oil prices surged.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，特朗普政府正在洽谈入股量子计算公司事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府正在与几家量子计算公司洽谈入股以换取联邦资金的事宜。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is in talks with several quantum-computing companies to take equity stakes in exchange for federal funding, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美元在 CPI 和贸易消息公布前走高；日元下滑
item.description: 周四，美元兑其他主要货币走高，交易商在等待周五推迟公布的美国消费者通胀数据，同时消化华盛顿和中国政府之间的关税威胁。【原文：The dollar drifted higher against its major peers on Thursday as traders waited on the delayed release of U.S. consumer inflation data on Friday, while digesting tariff threats between Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Polymarket 寻求估值高达 150 亿美元的融资
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，Polymarket 正在与投资者进行早期讨论，希望以 120 亿至 150 亿美元的估值筹集资金。【原文：Polymarket is in early discussions with investors and looking to raise funds at a valuation between $12 billion and $15 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 必和必拓表示澳大利亚冶金煤业务将面临 "艰难抉择
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）周四表示，如果没有监管改革的支持，该公司将被迫对其在澳大利亚的冶金煤业务做出 "艰难的决定"。【原文：BHP Group said on Thursday it would be forced to take 'difficult decisions' for its metallurgical coal business in Australia if there were no regulatory changes to support it.】

item.title: 美国对俄罗斯顶级石油公司实施制裁，欧盟对俄罗斯液化天然气实施禁令
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三对俄罗斯实施了与乌克兰有关的制裁，这是他第二个任期内首次针对石油公司卢克石油公司（Lukoil）和俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）实施制裁，因为他在战争问题上对俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）的不满情绪正在加深。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday imposed Ukraine-related sanctions on Russia for the first time in his second term, targeting oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft as his frustration grows with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war.】

item.title: OpenAI 将在政府合作的推动下提供英国数据居住权
item.description: 英国副首相戴维-拉米（David Lammy）将于本周四宣布，OpenAI 将从周五起为英国政府和企业提供在英国存储数据的机会，帮助更多公司和公共服务机构释放人工智能的潜力。【原文：OpenAI will offer Britain's government and businesses an opportunity to store data in the UK from Friday, helping unlock the potential of AI for more companies and public services, Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy will announce on Thursday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商敦促特朗普不要对工厂机器人和机械征收关税
item.description: 代表几乎所有主要汽车制造商的一个团体周三敦促唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府不要对工厂机器人和机械设备征收关税。【原文：A group representing nearly all major automakers on Wednesday urged the administration of President Donald Trump not to impose tariffs on factory robots and machinery.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯向伍德赛德的路易斯安那液化天然气企业注资 19 亿美元
item.description: 两家公司表示，总部位于美国的威廉姆斯公司将斥资 19 亿美元，为澳大利亚天然气生产商伍德赛德能源公司在路易斯安那州耗资 175 亿美元的液化天然气项目开发液化天然气设施和管道。【原文：U.S.-based Williams will spend $1.9 billion on the development of LNG facilities and a pipeline for Australian gas producer Woodside Energy's $17.5 billion liquefied natural gas project in Louisiana, the companies said.】

item.title: 下一页硅谷发布新处理器芯片，挑战英特尔和 AMD
item.description: 以色列初创公司 NextSilicon 的计算芯片正在接受美国国家实验室的评估，该公司周三表示，它正在开发一种中央处理器，希望能与英特尔和 AMD 竞争，并帮助它与 Nvidia 的系统竞争。【原文：NextSilicon, an Israeli startup whose computing chips are being evaluated by U.S. national labs, on Wednesday said it is developing a central processor that it hopes will rival Intel and AMD and help it compete with Nvidia's systems.】

item.title: 美国制裁俄罗斯石油公司和卢克石油公司后，美国原油期货上涨 1.3 美元，并称还将采取更多措施
item.description: 美国对俄罗斯主要石油公司俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）和卢克石油公司（Lukoil）实施制裁后，美国原油期货周四早盘上涨 1.3 美元，至每桶 59.81 美元。【原文：U.S. crude futures rose $1.3 to $59.81 per barrel in early trade on Thursday after the United States imposed sanctions on major Russian oil companies Rosneft and Lukoil .】

item.title: Waymo 将在纽瓦克机场手动测试自动驾驶汽车
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的 Waymo 公司周三表示，将在纽瓦克自由国际机场开始对其自动驾驶汽车进行人工测试，该公司希望将其自动驾驶汽车引入服务于纽约地区的三大机场之一。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo said on Wednesday it will begin manual testing of its autonomous vehicles at Newark Liberty International Airport, as the firm looks to bring its robotaxis to one of the three main airports serving the New York City area.】

item.title: 新加坡和澳门业务强劲，拉斯维加斯金沙季度利润超出预期
item.description: 由于新加坡和澳门业务的强劲需求，拉斯维加斯金沙周三公布的第三季度利润超出华尔街预期，盘后股价上涨超过 6%。【原文：Las Vegas Sands on Wednesday topped Wall Street expectations for third-quarter profit on strong demand from both its Singapore and Macau businesses, sending its shares up more than 6% after the bell.】

item.title: 福特斯库第一季度铁矿石发货量创历史新高，增长 4
item.description: 澳大利亚福特斯库公司（Fortescue）周四公布的第一季度铁矿石发货量增长了4.2%，由于赤铁矿发货量增加，该公司第一季度产量创下历史新高。【原文：Australia's Fortescue posted a 4.2% rise in first-quarter iron-ore shipments on Thursday, a record for first-quarter production for the firm on the back of higher hematite shipments.】

item.title: 需求强劲，皇冠城堡上调场地租赁年收入预期
item.description: 受无线基础设施服务需求稳定的影响，无线塔运营商皇冠城堡公司（Crown Castle）周三第二次上调了年度场地租赁收入预期。【原文：Wireless tower operator Crown Castle on Wednesday raised its annual site rental revenue forecast for the second time, helped by steady demand for wireless infrastructure services.】

item.title: 芯片制造工具需求旺盛，Lam Research 预计季度营收乐观
item.description: 由于芯片制造商订购了更多用于生产人工智能应用半导体的设备，Lam Research 公司周三预测第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期。【原文：Lam Research forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as chipmakers ordered more of its equipment used to manufacture semiconductors for artificial intelligence applications.】

item.title: 交易日：华尔街寻找红色十月
item.description: 美国股市周三下跌，原因是路透社的一篇报道称，美国正在考虑限制对中国的大量出口，这加剧了美中贸易战的担忧，也加重了Netflix财报失利的阴霾。【原文：U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday, as a Reuters report that the U.S. is considering curbs on a wide range of exports to China ratcheted up U.S.-Sino trade war fears and added to the gloom surrounding Netflix's earnings miss.】

item.title: 美国宣布对俄罗斯石油公司和卢克石油公司实施制裁
item.description: 美国对俄罗斯大型石油公司俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）和卢克石油公司（Lukoil）实施制裁，并表示准备采取进一步行动，同时呼吁莫斯科立即同意在俄罗斯的乌克兰战争中停火。【原文：The United States imposed sanctions on major Russian oil companies Rosneft and Lukoil, and said it was prepared to take further action as it called on Moscow to immediately agree to a ceasefire in Russia's war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 德事隆任命内部人士阿瑟顿为首席执行官，唐纳利继续担任董事长
item.description: 德事隆（Textron）飞机制造商周三表示，该公司首席执行官斯科特-唐纳利（Scott Donnelly）将由内部人士丽莎-阿瑟顿（Lisa Atherton）接任，明年 1 月 4 日生效。【原文：Textron chief executive Scott Donnelly will be succeeded by insider Lisa Atherton, effective January 4 next year, the aircraft maker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 西南航空第三季度盈利超预期
item.description: 受收入增长和运营成本低于预期的影响，美国西南航空公司周三出人意料地公布了第三季度盈利报告。【原文：Southwest Airlines surprisingly reported a third-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by stronger revenue and lower-than-expected operating costs.】

item.title: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽当选董事会主席，获得 2,500 万美元股票奖励
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）在周三提交的一份文件中说，她当选为董事会主席。【原文：Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser was elected as chair of board of directors, the bank said in a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 云计算需求强劲，SAP 第三季度利润增长 12
item.description: 德国软件制造商 SAP 周三公布，受强劲的云计算需求推动，第三季度利润增长了 12%。【原文：German software maker SAP on Wednesday reported a 12%rise in third-quarter profit, boosted by strong cloud demand.】

item.title: OpenAI 和甲骨文宣布星际之门数据中心选址威斯康星州
item.description: OpenAI 与甲骨文公司和 Vantage Data Centers 公司周三表示，将在威斯康星州华盛顿港的密尔沃基市外开发一个数据中心园区，作为星际之门项目的一部分。【原文：OpenAI, along with Oracle and Vantage Data Centers, will develop a data center campus outside Milwaukee, in Port Washington, Wisconsin, as part of the Stargate project, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能助力软件和大型机销售，IBM 季度业绩超预期
item.description: IBM周三公布的第三季度营收和利润超出华尔街预期，主要原因是软件和新型大型机需求旺盛，而人工智能模型的部署热潮又促进了支持这些模型的底层技术的销售。【原文：IBM beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit on Wednesday, driven by booming demand for its software and new mainframe as the rush to deploy AI models boosts sales for the underlying technology supporting them.】

item.title: 因天然气需求强劲，康德摩根第三季度利润增长
item.description: 受管道天然气运输量增加的影响，美国管道运营商金德摩根公司（Kinder Morgan）周三公布第三季度利润增长。【原文：U.S. pipeline operator Kinder Morgan posted a rise in third-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by higher volumes of natural gas transported through its pipelines.】

item.title: 税收减免到期推动美国电动汽车销量增长，特斯拉创纪录的收入超出预期
item.description: 特斯拉周三公布了创纪录的第三季度营收报告，超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于特斯拉电动汽车创下的最高季度销量，因为在美国一项关键的税收减免政策上个月到期之前，汽车买家纷纷抢购。【原文：Tesla reported record third-quarter revenue, beating Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by the highest quarterly sales of its electric vehicles as car buyers rushed to lock in a key U.S. tax credit ahead of its expiry last month.】

item.title: 空中客车公司预计到 2044 年全球货运机队将增长 45
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus）周三表示，在长期贸易增长的推动下，未来20年全球所有制造商的专用货机机队规模将增至3420架，增幅达45%。【原文：Airbus said on Wednesday the worldwide fleet of dedicated freighter aircraft by all makers should rise to 3,420 in the next 20 years, or a 45% increase, helped by long-term trade growth.】
